intro: Sida selloi, commonly known as the African mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like hibiscus and cotton. Sida selloi thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and fields. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes.
